contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=March 2011}} <!-- Deleted image removed: [[image:RonnieNealSutton.JPG|frame|right|Rep. Ronnie Sutton]] --> '''Ronnie Neal Sutton''' is a [[United States Democratic Party|Democratic]] member of the [[North Carolina General Assembly]]<ref name="Larson2006">{{cite book|last=Larson|first=Stephanie Greco|title=Media & minorities: the politics of race in news and entertainment|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=jIx1LIZPgDgC&pg=PA228|accessdate=31 March 2011|year=2006|publisher=Rowman & Littlefield|isbn=978-0-8476-9453-2|page=228}}</ref> representing the state's forty-seventh House district, including constituents in [[Hoke County, North Carolina|Hoke]] and [[Robeson County, North Carolina|Robeson]] counties. An attorney from [[Pembroke, North Carolina]], Sutton is currently (2009-2010 session) serving in his ninth term in the state House. Sutton is the only American Indian serving in the General Assembly, he is a member of the [[Lumbee]] Tribe of North Carolina. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Sutton, Ronnie N. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sutton, Ronnie N.}} [[Category:Members of the North Carolina House of Representatives]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Lumbee people]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
